channel.title: [562] Whats wrong with this code?!?![562]

item.title: [562] Whats wrong with this code?!?![562]
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

Ok i am trying to make a command to change your username…
This is what i got:

if(cmd[0].equals("changeuser")) { String user = command.substring((command.indexOf(" ") + 1)); XStreamPlayerLoader.punish.writeTo(user, "./data/text/UserNameChanges"); player.getPlayerDetails().username = Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(user); player.getPlayerDetails().displayName = Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(user); player.sm("your new username is "+user+" please note: LOG IN WITH YOUR FIRST USERNAME"); player.sm("YOUR OLD USERNAME (FIRST USER) YOU WILL NEED TO LOG IN WITH"); World.getInstance().engine().getWorkerThread().savePlayer(player); }

But all it does is make a new character file, how do i fix? help plox , it does change my name in game, but when i log in and out, boom back to my old one, also i can log into my username that i changed to, so it makes 2 char files… But can there be a way to delete the one? Also if i change my username, i can’t yell… please help

Read full topic
